greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Product of digits of all the divisors of n.
comment: Product of digits of concatenation of all divisors of n (A037278).
link: Nathaniel Johnston, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
formula: a(n) = 0 for n = multiples of 10; a(A008592(n)) = 0 for n >=1.
maple: A190997:=proc(n) local d, i, p: d:=numtheory[divisors](n): p:=1: for i from 1 to nops(d) do p:=p*mul(d, d=convert(d[i], base, 10)): od: return p: end: seq(A190997(n),n=1..57); # _Nathaniel Johnston_, Jun 15 2011
program: a(n) = my(div=divisors(n), pdt=1); for(k=1, #div, pdt=pdt*a007954(div[k])); pdt \\ _Felix Fröhlich_, Sep 22 2016
results.author: _Jaroslav Krizek_, Jun 15 2011
